doc.title: MVIEW

description.text: Reformats the results of a Multiple alignment

doc.reference: Brown, N.P., Leroy C., Sander C. (1998). MView: A Web compatible database search or multiple alignment viewer. Bioinformatics. 14(4):380-381.

interface.label: Output format (-out) HTML GCG/MSF Pearson/FASTA PIR/CODATA RDB table for storage/manipulation in relational database form

xhtml:div.label: Attach a ruler (-ruler) Yes No
Show alignment (-alignment) Yes No
Show consensus (-consensus) Yes No
Use DNA/RNA colormaps and/or consensus groups (-dna) Yes No

Colour scheme (-coloring)?
No colouring Colour all the residues Colouring by identity to the first sequence Colour only when above a given percent similarity Colours residues by the colour of the class to which they belong
Colour all the residues, will colour every residue according to the currently selected palette.
Colouring by identity to the first sequence, will colour only those residues that are identical to some reference sequence (usually the query or first row).
Colour only when above a given percent similarity, will colour only those residues that belong to a specified physicochemical class that is conserved in at least a specified percentage of all rows for a given column. This defaults to 70% and and may be set to another threshold, eg., -coloring consensus -threshold 80 would specify 80%. Note that the physicochemical classes in question can be confined to individual residues.
Colours residues by the colour of the class to which they belong, is like -coloring consensus, but colours residues by the colour of the class to which they belong.
By default, the consensus computation counts gap characters, so that sections of the alignment may be uncolored where the presence of gaps prevents the non-gap count from reaching the threshold. Setting -con_gaps off prevents this, allowing sequence-only based consensus thresholding.
Threshold percentage for consensus coloring (-threshold)

Ignore singleton or class group (-ignore)?
Class None Singleton
Tip: If you want to see only the conserved residues above the threshold (ie., only one type of conserved residue per column), add the option -ignore class.

Basic style of coloring (-con_coloring)?
Colour all the residues (any) Colouring by identity to the first sequence (identity) No colouring (none)
Colouring of an alignment by consensus determines which residues to colour and the colours to use based on
the consensus threshold chosen for the colouring operation,
a consideration of the common physicochemical properties of the residues in that column,
the chosen colour scheme.
Consensus line thresholds (in range 50..100) (separated by commas) (-con_threshold)
Ignore singleton or class group (-con_ignore) Class None Singleton
Count gaps during consensus computations (-con_gaps) Yes No
Report top N hits (-top)

Display column range M:N (-range)?
You must enter a string composed of two numbers separated by comma
Only report sequences with percent identity <= N (-maxident)
Use row N or row identifier as percent identity reference (-ref)

Keep only the rows from start to end (separated by comma) (-keep)?
You must enter a string composed of two numbers separated by comma

Discard rows from start to end (separated by comma) (-disc)?
You must enter a string composed of two numbers separated by comma

Display rows unprocessed (separated by comma ) (-nops)?
You must enter a string composed of two numbers separated by comma
Paginate in N columns of alignment (-width)
Use this character as the gap (-gap)
Switch off label: row number (-label0) Yes No
Switch off label: identifier (-label1) Yes No
Switch off label: description (-label2) Yes No
Switch off label: scores (-label3) Yes No
Switch off label: percent identity (-label4) Yes No
Output multi-pass alignments with columns in register (-register) Yes No

label.title: This parameter is mandatory under certain conditions.

xhtml:div.label: Amount of HTML markup (-html) Full Head Body Data CSS OFF
Page title string
Page background color (-pagecolor)
Page text color (-textcolor)
Link color (-linkcolor)
Active link color (-alinkcolor)
Visited link color (-vlinkcolor)
Alignment background color (-alncolor)
Alignment label color (-labcolor)
Alignment default text color (-symcolor)
Alignment gap color (-gapcolor)
Use bold emphasis for coloured residues (-bold) Yes No
Use Cascading Style Sheets (-css) OFF ON

ul.li: Colour all the residues, will colour every residue according to the currently selected palette.
Colouring by identity to the first sequence, will colour only those residues that are identical to some reference sequence (usually the query or first row).

Colour only when above a given percent similarity, will colour only those residues that belong to a specified physicochemical class that is conserved in at least a specified percentage of all rows for a given column. This defaults to 70% and and may be set to another threshold, eg., -coloring consensus -threshold 80 would specify 80%. Note that the physicochemical classes in question can be confined to individual residues.
Colours residues by the colour of the class to which they belong, is like -coloring consensus, but colours residues by the colour of the class to which they belong.

div.p: By default, the consensus computation counts gap characters, so that sections of the alignment may be uncolored where the presence of gaps prevents the non-gap count from reaching the threshold. Setting -con_gaps off prevents this, allowing sequence-only based consensus thresholding.

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: Tip: If you want to see only the conserved residues above the threshold (ie., only one type of conserved residue per column), add the option -ignore class.

div.p: Colouring of an alignment by consensus determines which residues to colour and the colours to use based on

ol.li: the consensus threshold chosen for the colouring operation,
a consideration of the common physicochemical properties of the residues in that column,
